Bindura University of Science Education (BUSE) has a rich history dating back to 1996 when it opened its doors as a college of science education.

The university has its roots in the Zimbabwe-Cuba Science Teacher Training programme, which began operating in the mid-1980s. In 2000, the government gazetted the Bindura University of Science Education Act, conferring university status to the college.

Today, BUSE boasts five faculties: Science Education, Science Engineering, Agriculture and Environmental Science, Commerce, and Social Sciences and Humanities. The university has grown significantly since its inception and operates from multiple campuses, including the main campus at FSE, Astra, Town, and others.

patterns: who is the vice chancellor of buse
responses: The Vice-Chancellor of Bindura University of Science Education is Professor Eddie Mwenje. He is a renowned academic and administrator with a strong background in microbiology, biotechnology, and business administration.

patterns: who is the bursar of buse
responses: The Bursar of Bindura University of Science Education is Mr. S.S Chaurura. He was appointed in May 2022 as the Chief Finance Officer.

To apply, download the application form from our website or obtain it from the Admissions Office. Pay the application fee and submit your application with certified copies of your qualifications and proof of payment.

patterns: what are the entry requirements for buse
responses: Entry requirements vary by program, but generally, you'll need 5 ordinary Level passes, including Mathematics and English Language, and 2 Advanced Level subject passes or their equivalent.

patterns: what undergraduate programs are offered at buse
responses: We offer various undergraduate programs, including Biological Sciences, Chemistry, Geography, and more. Check our website for specific requirements and restrictions on subject choices.

patterns: what postgraduate programs are offered at buse
responses: Our postgraduate programs include Master's and Doctoral degrees, with various specializations. Check our website for specific requirements and application procedures.

Masters Degrees by coursework. The normal entry requirements is an appropriate degree, professional qualification and experience or approved equivalent qualification. Other qualifications may be considered by the Senate on the recommendations of the departments and faculties concerned.

patterns: what postgraduate programs are offered at buse
responses: Our postgraduate programs include Master's and Doctoral degrees, with various specializations. Check our website for specific requirements and application procedures.

patterns: what is the masters degree program at buse
responses: Our Master's degree programs are designed to provide advanced knowledge and skills in various fields. Check our website for specific program details and requirements.

patterns: what is the phd program at buse
responses: Our PhD programs are designed to provide advanced research skills and knowledge in various fields. Check our website for specific program details and requirements.

patterns: what faculties are available at buse
responses: We have five faculties: Faculty of Commerce, Faculty of Social Sciences and Humanities, Faculty of Agriculture and Environmental Sciences, Faculty of Science and Engineering, and Faculty of Science Education.

patterns: what programs are offered in the commerce faculty at buse
responses: Our Faculty of Commerce offers programs in Accountancy, Economics, Supply Chain Management, Marketing, Human Resources Management, Banking and Finance, and Financial Intelligence.

patterns: what programs are offered in the social sciences faculty at buse
responses: Our Faculty of Social Sciences and Humanities offers programs in Peace and Governance, Social Work, Culture and Heritage Studies, and Communication Science.

patterns: what programs are offered in the agriculture faculty at buse
responses: Our Faculty of Agriculture and Environmental Sciences offers programs in Forestry, Wildlife and Rangeland Ecology, Safety, Health and Environmental Management, Crop Science, Animal Science, Agricultural Economics and Management, and Agricultural Education and Extension.

patterns: what programs are offered in the science faculty at buse
responses: Our Faculty of Science and Engineering offers programs in Biological Sciences, Biotechnology, Applied Mathematics, Statistics and Financial Mathematics, Physics, Chemical Technology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Information Technology, Sport Science and Management, Development Studies and Geo Sciences, Disaster Management, Nursing Education, Optometry, and Electronic Engineering.
We offer various postgraduate programs, including:
• Master of Science Education degrees (e.g., MScEDMAE, Measurement, Assessment and Evaluation)

• Master of Science degrees in various fields (e.g., Biodiversity Conservation, Applied Microbiology, Environmental Physics, Analytical Chemistry, Inorganic Chemistry, Disaster Risk Management, Physical Chemistry, Natural Resources Management, Climate Change and Sustainable Development)
• Postgraduate Diploma in Statistics and Financial Mathematics
• Master's degrees in Business and Leadership (e.g., MBA, MSc in Entrepreneurship and Innovation, Executive MBA, MSc in Leadership and Corporate Governance)
• Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in various fields
Here is the fees structure for Bindura University of Science Education:
• Faculty of Commerce & Social Sciences & Humanities: US$665 (Part 1 & 2), US$525 (Part 3), US$665 (Part 4)
• Faculty of Science & Engineering, Agriculture & Science Education: US$725 (Part 1 & 2), US$563 (Part 3), US$705 (Part 3)
• Medicine – Optometry: US$745 (All Parts, Part 1 to 4)
• Diploma in Sciences Education: US$595 (Part 1 to 2.1), US$485 (Part 2.2 & 3.1), US$575 (Part 3.2)
Welcome international students! Our International Relations Office provides various services to support your transition to Bindura University of Science Education.
We assist with: visa issues, accommodation, counselling, exchange opportunities, and international university resources.
Tuition fees for international students are US$2,500 per semester.
We offer on-campus accommodation for international students, including halls of residence and self-catering apartments.
Our accommodation services include: meals in dining halls, basic furniture, and support for private accommodation arrangements.
International students are integrated with local students in university residences, promoting a diverse and inclusive community.
Welcome to Campus Life at Bindura University of Science Education!
Orientation Programme: Join our 5-day orientation programme to get acquainted with the university facilities and environment.
Academic Year: Our academic year consists of two semesters, with the first semester running from August to December and the second semester from February to June.
Student Organizations: Join our 50+ student organizations, clubs, and societies to experience our vibrant social life on campus.

Student Health and Counselling: Our campus has student health facilities, including general practitioners, nurses, psychiatrists, and psychologists. We also offer counselling services at departmental and faculty levels.
Sports and Recreation: Our Department of Sports offers a wide range of activities, from soccer and basketball to swimming and theatre, catering to all interests and levels of commitment.
Welcome to the ICT Department!

We provide responsive, effective, and efficient ICT services, including:, • Internet and email services, • Integrated university management system, • Website management, • Networking and connectivity, • ICT hardware and software procurement and maintenance, • Information security and advisory services
Feel free to reach out to us anytime for ICT support and assistance.
The University Registrar is Mr. Jairos Makunde.

Mr. Makunde has over 32 years of experience in higher education, holding various degrees and diplomas in fields like Business Administration, Education, and Law. He has previously served as University Registrar at Lupane State University and Chinhoyi University of Technology.
The University Librarian is Dr. Blessing Chiparausha.

Dr. Chiparausha was appointed in January 2022, bringing extensive experience from previous roles at Bindura University Science Education. He holds a PhD in Information Science and has published research on the use of technology in academic libraries.
Bindura University houses the National Sports Academy, which facilitates the development of identified talent with the aim of achieving international success.
The National Sports Academy is also set to promote research in high-performance sport development and any such research that can improve decision making in sport.
The National Sports Academy aims to establish partnerships with international organizations and donor agencies to support joint programmes.

The Department of Sports Science at Bindura University offers an innovative curriculum that focuses on providing knowledge-based solutions to various aspects of sports and exercise science, physical activity, health, and sports management.

The department aims to produce knowledgeable, skilled, innovative, and entrepreneurial graduates through teaching and research. Their vision is to become an internationally renowned sports science and management education center by 2023.

Sport is considered a cornerstone for the overall development of students at Bindura University. The Sports and Recreation department fosters learning across three domains: cognitive, affective, and psychomotor.

patterns: Master of Science Degree in Sports Science
responses: The university offers a Master of Science Degree in Sports Science to bridge the current deficiencies in advanced sports science skills within the Zimbabwean sports industry.

patterns: bachelor of science in computer science
responses: Bindura University of Science Education offers a Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Computer Science, a four-year program that equips graduates with a strong foundation in computer science.

patterns: what is the computer science program about
responses: The program covers areas such as networking, software engineering, and programming, focusing on the practical aspects of developing and delivering software.
During the third year of study, students are expected to go on attachment to gain practical experience.

patterns: what skills do computer science graduates gain
responses: Graduates emerge with theoretical, technical, and practical knowledge, making them well-prepared for high-tech and entrepreneurial careers in the field of computer science. Some of the skills they acquire include networking, software engineering, project management, object-oriented programming, data structures, databases, algorithm design and analysis, computer security, and information systems management.

patterns: Faculty of Agriculture and Environmental Science
responses: The Faculty of Agriculture and Environmental Science (FAES) at Bindura University of Science Education was established in 2001, recognizing the significance of agriculture to Zimbabwe's national economy and the increasing need for sustainable environmental management.

patterns: Department of Agricultural Economics, Education, and Extension
responses: This department offers the Bachelor of Agricultural Science Honours Degree (Agricultural Economics and Management) program, available under conventional or block release arrangements.

patterns: MSc in Food Security and Sustainable Agriculture
responses: The MSc in Food Security and Sustainable Agriculture can be pursued as a weekend or block release program at either the Harare or Bindura campuses.

The FAES aims to provide a conducive environment for research, teaching, and learning, characterized by innovation and the use of modern technology. Their core values include honesty, respect, quality customer service, student-centeredness, knowledge acquisition and sharing, teamwork and diversity, innovation and excellence, and commitment and discipline.
The Optometry Department at Bindura University of Science Education is dedicated to training optometrists and contributing to a lifetime of visual health and wellness.
The Optometry department aims to improve each patient's visual health and quality of life through extensive training of optometrists.
The department aspires to be an institution of exceptional training for optometrists, delivering comprehensive eye care to patients of all ages with different ocular challenges.

The Optometry department's core values include dedicated teaching, varied learning, research, stakeholder participation and engagement, student-centered approach, collaboration, disciplined staff and students, and upholding the highest integrity.

patterns: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Optometry
responses: The Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Optometry offered by Bindura University prepares students to perform comprehensive eye examinations using special techniques.

Zimbabwe's first-ever School of Optometry was established at Bindura University of Science Education, emphasizing the importance of this specialized health care profession centered on eye examination, ocular diseases, and general health.

patterns: Department of Culture and Heritage Studies
Culture and Heritage at Bindura University
responses: The Department of Culture and Heritage Studies is part of the Faculty of Social Sciences and Humanities at Bindura University.

patterns: Bindura University culture and heritage curriculum
responses: The department's curriculum covers various subjects, including Archaeology, Museum studies, Heritage conservation, Cultural policy, and Records and information management.
Students engage in rigorous academic coursework, practical fieldwork, and research projects.
The department prioritizes inclusivity, creativity, and social responsibility.
The Department of Culture and Heritage Studies envisions contributing to building a society where culture and heritage serve as the foundation of human civilization.
The department aims to celebrate cultural diversity, preserve heritage, and foster intergenerational connections.

To qualify for normal entry into the Bachelor of Science (Honours) degree in Culture and Heritage Studies, prospective students must have obtained at least five 'O' Level subjects, including English Language passed with a Grade C or better, and have obtained 'A' level passes in at least two of the Arts and Humanities subjects.
The Department of Social Work aims to deliver quality education, excel in research, and become leaders in community services.
The department endeavors to promote human welfare through education, research, and community engagement.
The department upholds values such as humanity, morality, integrity, character, and hard work.
It is affiliated with the International Association of Schools of Social Work (IASSW), which includes over 200 institutions worldwide that train social work professionals.
Bindura University of Science Education (BUSE) provides off-campus accommodation options for students who prefer to live outside the university premises.
The Off-Campus Life section, housed in the Student Affairs Division, aims to improve living conditions and student welfare off-campus.
For inquiries regarding on-campus accommodation, you can contact the Warden at 0772772464.
BUSE has limited on-campus accommodation, and allocation is based on a priority list.
The Engineering Workshops Block project is currently underway. Once completed, it will house Agriculture and Electronic Engineering students.
The Innovation Hub is another significant project at BUSE. Most of the main construction work has been completed, and the hub is projected to be at 98% completion.
The Infrastructure Development Bank of Zimbabwe (IDBZ) is partnering with BUSE to improve student accommodation.

BUSE offers a variety of programs, including Masters in Purchasing Supply and Chain Management, BSc in Electronic Engineering, BSc in Optometry, BSc in Animal Health and Production Extension, BSc in Culture and Heritage Studies, BSc in Agricultural Engineering, and a Postgraduate Diploma in Infection Prevention and Control.
The library is located at the Town Campus in Bindura, Zimbabwe.
It houses collections from all five faculties.
The library has a print collection accessible at the Town Campus.
In addition to the print collection, the BUSE Library provides access to millions of electronic resources.
Access to electronic books (e-books).
Subscriptions to peer-reviewed journals.
A repository containing research output and intellectual property of the university.
Zimbabwe has a diverse religious landscape with Christianity, African Traditional Religion, Islam, and Hinduism, among others.
Christianity is the dominant religion in Zimbabwe, with an estimated 78% of the population identifying as Christian.
African Traditional Religion is practiced by an estimated 18% of the population in Zimbabwe.
Despite constitutional provisions, Christianity has dominated the religious scene, leading to challenges for non-Christian groups and potential inter-religious conflicts.
Measures to maintain peace and coexistence include institutional diplomacy, education curricula, ridicule, demonization, and controlling public space.

Pressure groups involved in promoting religious coexistence include the Zimbabwe Council of Churches, Evangelical Fellowship of Zimbabwe, Zimbabwe Christian Alliance, Muslim and traditional healer associations.

patterns: What is the vision of Bindura University?
responses: Our vision is to be an internationally renowned university producing transformative and innovative graduates.

patterns: What is the mission of Bindura University?
responses: Our mission is to produce responsible, knowledgeable, skilled, innovative and entrepreneurial graduates through teaching, research innovation; and develop products and services for industrialisation and community transformation.

patterns: What are the core values of Bindura University?
responses: Our core values are integrity, student centredness, teamwork, commitment, diversity, and innovativeness.

patterns: Courses offered at Faculty of Science Education
responses: The Faculty of Science Education at BUSE is dedicated to educating science teachers in various disciplines, including Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Technology, Geography, and Agriculture. Our mission is to prepare caring, accountable, and critical-reflective pre-service science teachers who can support learning and development in diverse educational contexts.

Our faculty consists of experienced academics who collaborate in inter-disciplinary work to produce cutting-edge research and integrate it into student learning experiences. We work closely with schools and other stakeholders to ensure that theory and practice are in dialogue with each other.

The faculty has the following departments: Department of Educational Foundation, Department of Educational Technology, Department of Curriculum Studies, Department of Science and Mathematics Education. The Faculty is housed at the Faculty of Science Education Complex in Shashi View.

Our vision is to be a hub of knowledge and a beacon of excellence in teaching, research and extension services in STEM Education, and our mission is to increase the number of students skilled and interested in pursuing STEM related jobs, degrees, and careers.
Our core values are respect, honesty, and community centeredness. For more information, you can contact us at +263 719 528 681 or fse@buse.ac.zw.

The Faculty of Science Education at BUSE offers the following programmes: Diploma in Science Education, Bachelor of Science Education Honours Degree, Postgraduate Diploma in Tertiary Education, Master of Science Education, and DPhil/PhD Programmes.
The programmes are offered in various disciplines, including Mathematics, Chemistry, Physics, Biology, Geography, Agriculture, and Computer Science.
The faculty also offers off-campus programmes, which are designed to be technology-enhanced and interactive, reducing costs and increasing accessibility for students.

The Faculty of Science and Engineering at BUSE offers programmes in Biological Sciences, Chemistry, Computer Science, Disaster Risk Reduction, Engineering and Physics, Geography, Health Sciences, Mathematics, Optometry, and Sports Science.
Our vision is to be a hub of knowledge and a beacon of excellence in teaching, research, innovation, and community engagement via Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) disciplines.

Our graduates are employed in various fields, including research and development, government departments, state enterprises, institutions, non-governmental organisations, UN bodies, and private companies.

patterns: Faculty of Social Sciences and Humanities
Social Sciences and Humanities at BUSE
responses: The Faculty of Social Sciences and Humanities at BUSE offers programmes in Social Work, Peace and Governance, Languages and Communication Skills, Culture and Heritage Studies, and more.

Our vision is to be a faculty of excellence in teaching, community service, and research in the fields of social sciences, imparting learning, skills, and values for the promotion and development of Zimbabwe and the world.

Our graduates are employed in government, non-governmental organisations, and the private sector, and we train social scientists to address significant social issues and promote ethical reasoning and compassion.

The Faculty of Commerce offers various programs, including undergraduate degrees in Accountancy, Economics, Marketing, Human Resources Management, Banking and Finance, Financial Intelligence, and Police and Security Studies. Postgraduate programs include Master of Science Degree in Economics, Master of Science Degree in Purchasing and Supply Chain Management, Master of Business Leadership (MBL) degree, and Masters in Entrepreneurship and Innovation.

patterns: faculty of agriculture and environmental science
responses: The Faculty of Agriculture and Environmental Science offers various programs, including undergraduate degrees in Agricultural Economics, Animal Science, Crop Science, Environmental Science, and Natural Resources. Postgraduate programs include Master of Science in Occupational Health Safety and Environmental, and other programs focused on sustainable development in agriculture and environmental science.

The Research and Innovation Department (RID) at Bindura University of Science Education provides support for research and postgraduate studies, including scholarships, research grants, and conference paper presentation grants. The department also offers workshops and training programs for higher degrees students and staff.

Bindura University of Science Education offers work related learning opportunities through industrial attachments in various faculties, including Science Education, Science, Agriculture and Environmental Sciences, Social Sciences and Humanities, and Commerce. Please download the attachment guidelines and industrial attachment policy for more information.

To ensure off-campus safety, travel in groups, carry a cell phone, take advantage of campus transportation, and report crimes to ZRP and BUSE Security. Also, keep your home secure by locking doors, using safety bars, trimming trees, and maintaining good lighting. Be aware of your surroundings, plan your route, and walk with confidence. Share safety tips with others to ensure a safe stay and prosperous studies.

The Catering Services Section at Bindura University of Science Education offers customized menus for various occasions, including dining services, special dietary needs, conference services, and event planning. Our services aim to provide quality, nutritious food and excellent customer service, aligning with the university's core values and strategic plan.

The Sports and Recreation department at Bindura University of Science Education aims to promote physical and mental well-being through various sports and recreational activities, including traditional team games, tournaments, and fitness programs. Our state-of-the-art gymnasium is available to students, staff, and the community at a nominal fee.

The Campus Accommodation office at Bindura University of Science Education is responsible for allocating housing to students, with priority given to students with disabilities, first-year students, and final-year students. The university has two halls of residence with a total capacity of 398 students, and additional off-campus housing options are available through partnerships with the local community.

The Chaplaincy Desk at Bindura University of Science Education provides spiritual support, pastoral care, and counselling services to the university community, promoting multi-faith values and leadership qualities. The office offers prayers, consolation, support, and spiritual guidance in various situations, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to usher God's presence in the university.

Ethics at the workplace are essential for a successful organisation. Unethical behaviour leads to conflicts, demotivation, and business failure. Common ethics include confidentiality, honesty, promise-keeping, loyalty, and respect for property. Good ethics boost business, lead to promotions, and create a pleasant work environment. Sexual harassment is a serious offence and should be reported to the authorities. Doing the right thing, even when it's difficult, is essential for good ethics.

The Department of Student Affairs at Bindura University of Science Education, led by Dean Mr. Mazodze, provides support services to students, including academic guidance, personal development, health and wellness, accommodation, and extracurricular activities. The department aims to create a conducive environment for teaching, learning, and research, and to produce well-rounded graduates.

The Registry Department at Bindura University of Science Education, headed by the Registrar, is responsible for ensuring the university's compliance with legal frameworks and statutes. The department oversees academic regulations, student admissions, registration, records, examinations, faculty administration, and teaching and learning facilities, as well as liaison services for international students.
